alert.note: Alert for Bastrop (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 20 at 10:13PM CDT until April 20 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Bastrop and Fayette. * WHEN...Until 130 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1013 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... La Grange, Smithville, Fayetteville, Round Top, Upton, Carmine, Rabbs Prairie, Warda, Plum, Nechanitz, Winchester, Rutersville, Waldeck, West Point, Walhalla, Mullins Prairie, Warrenton, Kirtley, Ledbetter and Ellinger. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
